title: Definition of Prototype Pattern
content: What is the Prototype Pattern and why is it useful in JavaScript?
explanation: The Prototype Pattern allows objects to share properties and methods through the prototype chain. It avoids duplication and reduces memory usage by letting instances inherit methods from the prototype instead of redefining them.
sampleAnswers: The Prototype Pattern allows objects to share properties and methods through the prototype chain.
It avoids duplication and reduces memory usage by letting instances inherit methods from the prototype instead of redefining them.

title: Prototype vs Instance Properties
content: In the Dog class example, where is the bark() method stored?
explanation: The correct answer is: On Dog.prototype, shared by all instances

options.text: On Dog.prototype, shared by all instances

title: Adding Properties Dynamically
content: If you add Dog.prototype.play after creating instances, will existing instances have access to play()?
explanation: The correct answer is: Yes, because all instances reference the same prototype

options.text: Yes, because all instances reference the same prototype
No, only future instances get it
It depends on whether the object was frozen

title: Prototype Chain
content: How does JavaScript resolve a property that isnâ€™t found directly on an object?
explanation: It traverses the prototype chain via __proto__ until it finds the property or reaches null. This process is called prototype chaining.
sampleAnswers: It traverses the prototype chain via __proto__ until it finds the property or reaches null.
This process is called prototype chaining.

title: Inheritance with Prototype
content: In the SuperDog example, how does SuperDog gain access to bark() from Dog?
explanation: The correct answer is: By extending Dog, SuperDog.prototype.__proto__ points to Dog.prototype

options.text: By extending Dog, SuperDog.prototype.__proto__ points to Dog.prototype
Each SuperDog has its own bark() copy
By redefining bark in the constructor

title: Object.create Use Case
content: What does Object.create allow you to do?
explanation: It creates a new object with its prototype explicitly set to the provided object. This lets you directly inherit properties without using classes or constructors.
sampleAnswers: It creates a new object with its prototype explicitly set to the provided object.
This lets you directly inherit properties without using classes or constructors.

title: Prototype Pattern Advantages
content: What are two main advantages of the Prototype Pattern?
explanation: It reduces memory usage by sharing methods across instances. It allows dynamic extension of behavior by modifying the prototype.
sampleAnswers: It reduces memory usage by sharing methods across instances.
It allows dynamic extension of behavior by modifying the prototype.

title: Prototype Pitfalls
content: Which of the following can be a downside of relying too heavily on prototype chaining?
explanation: The correct answer is: Deep prototype chains can make debugging difficult and slow property lookups

options.text: Deep prototype chains can make debugging difficult and slow property lookups
